summary: Core Cursor concepts including Agent, Inline Edit, Tab autocomplete, Rules, Semantic Search, MCP, Context, and Models - the fundamentals of AI-assisted coding.
key_takeaways: Tab provides code completion that predicts multi-line edits based on your current code and recent changes.
Agent is an AI that can read and modify code across multiple files autonomously.
Inline Edit lets you edit selected code with natural language using Cmd+K.
Rules define custom instructions for AI behavior including coding standards and project conventions.

questions.question: What keyboard shortcut do you use to trigger Inline Edit in Cursor?
questions.explanation: Inline Edit is triggered with Cmd+K, allowing you to describe changes in natural language and see them applied in place.

questions.question: What is the key difference between Semantic Search and regular text search in Cursor?

options.text: Semantic Search only works with Python files
Semantic Search finds code by meaning, not just exact text matches
Semantic Search is slower but more accurate for syntax errors
Semantic Search only works in the terminal

questions.explanation: Semantic Search finds code by understanding its meaning, enabling natural language code search and context-aware suggestions rather than just matching text patterns.

questions.question: What does MCP (Model Context Protocol) enable in Cursor?

options.text: Integration with external tools like databases, APIs, and documentation sources

questions.explanation: MCP (Model Context Protocol) connects Cursor to external tools and data sources including databases, APIs, and documentation, extending the AI's capabilities beyond just code.
